basket.title: The Artist's Garden at Vetheuil
basket.description: The years that Monet spent at a rented pink house in VÃ©theuil were among the most difficult of his life. The market for his work had collapsed; his wife fell ill and died; his servants all quit. And yet the pictures he painted there, in his lush, sunny garden conceived as an outdoor studio, are among the most exuberant of his career.
basket.img: /src/assets/images//Monet - The Artist's Garden at Vetheuil Plakat.png

basket.title: Paix
basket.description: La Colombe de la Paix was painted by Pablo Picasso during the Vietnam War approximately 60-65 years ago. The exact year is not known. The beautiful dove carries an olive branch in its beak and is inspired by the international symbol of peace. A beautiful and significant, small poster to have hanging in the home. Perfect for the minimalist and the art lover.
basket.img: /src/assets/images//Screenshot 2023-03-06 at 12-24-15 Et La Paix exhibition poster - Picasso.png

basket.title: The Ten Largest Childhood
basket.description: Hilma af Klint's artistic talents showed early, as did her interest in spiritualism and philosophy. In recent years, her art has become more relevant than ever. Hilma af Klint's sense of shapes and colors in her distinctive art style is like a connection between the invisible spirit world and the visible, real one we live in. Big, bold shapes and fantastic color combinations make her artwork appeal to so many.
basket.img: /src/assets/images/Hilma af Klint - The Ten Largest Childhood No. 2 Plakat.png
